ukim.finki.mps.delay_function_generator
Class InstructionSet

java.lang.Object
  ukim.finki.mps.delay_function_generator.InstructionSet

public class InstructionSet
extends java.lang.Object

object containing all the instructions and their definitions, as defined in the manual

Author:
Andrej Gajduk

getInstruction

public InstructionData getInstruction(java.lang.String string)
given the instruction_code return the InstructionData object that it corresponds to

Parameters:
string - - instruction code as seen in assembler compiler
Returns:
InstructionData for the given instruction code, null if no such instruction exists *FURTHER NOTICE:this method is rarely called, otherwise it will have to be accelerated by using a HashMap or a Trie

getInitInstructionsDuration

public int getInitInstructionsDuration(int loop_type)
returns the set specific initialization instruction duration

Parameters:
loop_type - - specifies whether we are making a 8bit loop or a 16bit loop
Returns:
duration in T states of the mP

Parameters:
loop_type - - specifies whether we are making a 8bit loop or a 16bit loop
Returns:
duration in T states of the mP

getRetInstrcution

public Executable getRetInstrcution()
returns the set specific initialization instruction duration e.g. for 8085 RET

Returns:
executable representation of this set return statement

getInitInstrcution

public Executable getInitInstrcution(int loop_type,
                                     java.lang.String reg_or_reg_pair,
                                     int init_value)
returns the set specific initialization instruction code segment e.g. for 8085 DCR R

Parameters:
loop_type - - specifies whether we are making a 8bit loop or a 16bit loop
reg_or_reg_pair - - the register element which is participating in the loop
init_value - - this value is to be set to the register specified
Returns:
a code segment used to initialize the elements for loop-logic

returns the set specific decrementing instruction code segment e.g. for 8085 DCR R

Parameters:
loop_type - - specifies whether we are making a 8bit loop or a 16bit loop
Returns:
a code segment used to decrement the elements for loop-logic

Parameters:

Parameters:
reg - - the register we are trying to pop
Returns:

Parameters:
reg - - the register we are trying to push
Returns:
a code segment used to make a push on the stack of the given reg

getMoveInstruction

public Executable getMoveInstruction(java.lang.String dest,
                                     java.lang.String src)
returns the set specific move instruction code segment e.g. for 8085 MOV Rd,Rs

Parameters:
dest - - the register we are copying to
src - - the register we are copying from
Returns:
a code segment used to copy a value

getLoadInstruction

public Executable getLoadInstruction(java.lang.String memory_location)
returns the set specific instruction code segment for reading from memory e.g. for 8085 LDA memory

Parameters:
memory_location - - the memory address we are reading from to
Returns:
a code segment used to read from memory

getStoreInstruction

public Executable getStoreInstruction(java.lang.String memory_location)
returns the set specific instruction code segment for writing to memory e.g. for 8085 LDA memory

Parameters:
memory_location - - the memory address we are writing to
Returns:
a code segment used to write to memory

getAllAvailableInstructions

public java.util.ArrayList<InstructionData> getAllAvailableInstructions(Element[] elements_usable)
this function will take all the arguments, separate the instructions that we can use out of the whole instruction set of the mP with respect to the elements_usable,

Parameters:
instruction_set - - an object describing the instruction set of a given mP, it contains all the instructions fully described
elements_usable - - descriptors for all the elements that are available to the function to operate with, such as registers and memory locations
Returns:
- array list of instructions descriptions *IMPORTANT NOTICE: if there are two instruction or more each of duration 'k' then only one instruction will be taken in consideration we don;t need any repetition
